in_ports.name: non_filled_mask
in_ports.hint:
[Optional] If specified, then the pixels, for which this mask contains non-zero values, will be not filled:
flood-filling algorithm cannot go across them.

out_ports.name: mask
out_ports.hint:
Binary result: non-zero elements correspond to flood-filled pixels.
If "Return only modified rectangle" flag is set, it is the rectangular part of the mask, corresponding to "modified rectangle" below.

out_ports.name: filled
out_ports.hint:
Source image, filled by "Filling color". It is returned only if "Filling mode" is "Fill with accumulating (mask + image)".
If "Return only modified rectangle" flag is set, it is the rectangular part of the source, corresponding to "modified rectangle" below.

out_ports.name: modified_rectangle
out_ports.caption: modified rectangle
out_ports.hint:
Rectangle, modified in the mask: min_x, max_x, min_y, max_y
(in coordinates of the source image: 0 ≤ min_x, max_x < dim_x, 0 ≤ min_y, max_y < dim_y).

out_ports.name: max_border
out_ports.hint:
Maximal value among all 2 * (dim_x + dimY) − 4 elements of the border of the result mask.
But if "Extended mask" is set, the external 1-pixel boundary is excluded from the analysis (it dos not contain interesting values).

out_ports.name: max_top
out_ports.hint:
Maximal value among all dim_x elements of the top bound of the result mask.
But if "Extended mask", is set, the external 1-pixel boundary is excluded from the analysis (it dos not contain interesting values).

out_ports.name: max_bottom
out_ports.hint:
Maximal value among all dim_x elements of the bottom bound of the result mask.
But if "Extended mask" is set, the external 1-pixel boundary is excluded from the analysis (it dos not contain interesting values).

out_ports.name: max_left
out_ports.hint:
Maximal value among all dim_y elements of the left bound of the result mask.
But if "Extended mask" is set, the external 1-pixel boundary is excluded from the analysis (it dos not contain interesting values).

out_ports.name: max_right
out_ports.hint:
Maximal value among all dim_y elements of the right bound of the result mask.
But if "Extended mask" is set, the external 1-pixel boundary is excluded from the analysis (it dos not contain interesting values).

controls.name: reset
controls.description: If set, this function initializes its state from the input ports; all previously accumulated information is removed. If cleared, this function works with stored image and masks and ignores input ports; it is the maximally quick mode.

controls.name: fillingMode
controls.caption: Filling mode
controls.description:
"Fill initial mask" and "Fill with accumulating" modes differ if "reset" flag is cleared "Fill initial mask", after processing, resets the mask to initial state (empty or a copy of "non_filled_mask"); so, the following call will work with the initial, not a new mask.
"Fill with accumulating (mask + image)" is the only mode, when this function modifies the input matrix; in all other modes, OpenCV floodFill function is executed with the flag FLOODFILL_MASK_ONLY.

items.caption: Fill at initial mask and insert to accumulator
Fill at initial mask and remove from accumulator

controls.name: returnOnlyModifiedRectangle
controls.caption: Return only modified rectangle
controls.description: If set, this function returns (in "mask" and "filled" results) only the content of modified rectangle (returned in the corresponding output port). It allows to optimize speed and minimize the volume of returned data.

controls.name: percents
controls.description: If set, seeding X/Y below are measured in percents of image sizes.

controls.name: y
controls.caption: Seeding Y
controls.description: Seeding X/Y are the coordinates of starting point for flood-filling algorithm.

controls.name: maxFillingSize
controls.caption: Maximal filling size D
controls.description: If D>0, this function restricts filling by circle with diameter D pixels around seeding X/Y.

controls.name: loDiff
controls.description: "loDiff" argument of OpenCV floodFill function (for color image, it will be equal to this value for every channel).

controls.name: upDiff
controls.description:
"upDiff" argument of OpenCV floodFill function (for color image, it will be equal to this value for every channel).
Note: you may skip one of "loDiff" and "upDiff" parameters (stay empty string), then the other from them will be used for both arguments of floodFill function. (If both parameters are not specified, 0.0 value will be used.)

controls.name: rawDiffValues
controls.caption: Raw xxDiff values
controls.description: If set, "loDiff" and "upDiff" values above are used as-is. So, for byte matrix they should be 1 or greater (like 5 or 10), but for floating-point one they should in 0..1 range (like 0.1). If cleared, these parameters are automatically scaled and should be in 0..1 range.

controls.name: floodFillFixedRange
controls.caption: Fixed flood-filling range
controls.description:
If set, the difference between the current pixel and seed pixel is considered. Otherwise, the difference between neighbor pixels is considered (that is, the range is floating).
In other words, when this flag is cleared, the function fills throw smooth areas and stops only at sharp borders.. Corresponds to OpenCV flag FLOODFILL_FIXED_RANGE.

controls.name: fillColor
controls.caption: Filling color
controls.description: This argument is used only in the mode "Fill with accumulating (mask + image)".

controls.name: connectivity
controls.caption: Connectivity
controls.description: The connectivity of the filled area. In 8-connection mode, the filling algorithm ignores 1-pixel diagonal boundary (goes through it).

controls.name: extendedMask
controls.caption: Extended mask
controls.description: If set, the returned mask and (if specified) the source non_filled_mask are extended by 1 pixel to each direction: the mask is 2 pixels wider and 2 pixels taller than the image. It increases performance a little. Usually it is more convenient to clear this flag.

controls.name: includeNonFilledMask
controls.caption: Include non-filled mask
controls.description: If set, the source non_filled_mask is also included in the result (this is default behaviour if OpenCV floodFill function). If cleared, the source non_filled_mask is removed from the result — but it requires additional time (maybe essential in comparison with flood-filling algorithm).

controls.name: packBits
controls.caption: Pack bits in the result
controls.description: If set, bits in the resulting mask are packed (binary matrix). If cleared, every element in the result mask will occupy 1 byte.

controls.name: visibleResult
controls.caption: Visible result
controls.description: Note: the variant "Image (filled with color)" has a sense only in the mode "Fill with accumulating (mask + image)".
